title_sort: walt whitman to richard maurice bucke, 12 may 1890
title: Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 12 May 1890
text: Mickle Street CamdenMay 12 '90No very mark'd change in the situation. Warry (my young man) has just been in to urge me to get out in wheel chair, wh' I shall—the sun is out, & the temperature mildens.I send off a little piece to Century this evn'g. Have also written a little five line bit in compliment to Queen Victoria's birth day (May 24) wh' I shall send out—Alys Smith was here yesterday—it is quite possible Mary & her husband & children may come to America forthwith on a flying trip—Herbert Gilchrist has gone to Centreport (L I near Huntington) for a long stay—Shall look for you Thursday—or Friday at furthest—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 12 May 1890
